intro: Sida subsessilis, commonly known as the woolly sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species that typically grows in dry, disturbed soils. The plant features small, pale yellow flowers and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Sida subsessilis is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields.
